results.title: Energy: new sources. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Robert Churchill, Churchill Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: Looks at potential alternatives to our present dependence on fossil fuels, such as solar energy, nuclear fusion, geothermal and synthetic fuels. The future of the world’s energy supplies is cast in an optimistic light.

results.title: Energy: less is more. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Robert Churchill, Churchill Films and Thomas Smith
results.brief_description: Looks at various ways to make more efficient use of the world’s dwindling supplies of fossil fuels: transportation systems, industrial applications, and building construction. Includes a case study of energy conservation in Davis County, California.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Churchill, Churchill Films and Thomas Smith

results.title: Energy: can't do without it
results.brief_description: Examines a variety of sources of energy in the world today, including electrical energy, coal, oil and other fossil fuels. Shows the great importance of energy in modern society.

results.title: Energy: a national issue
results.creator_credit: Ross M Sutherland, Hanna-Barbera Productions, Instructional Media and Gerard H. Baldwin
results.brief_description: Animated film featuring the Flintstones with narration by Charlton Heston to explain the problems of a dwindling energy supply and the means by which to obtain more efficient energy use. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Energy. Ep. 3. New sources
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Anthony Morris, Jane Treiman and George McQuilkin
results.brief_description: Examines the potential and limits of new technologies, including solar, fusion and geothermal. Presents an argument for developing a variety of options. Stresses societies need to develop ways of using less energy. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Energy. Ep. 2. The Nuclear alternative
results.creator_credit: Churchill Films, Anthony Morris, Jane Treiman and George McQuilkin
results.brief_description: Explores fission power, how it works and the controversies over safety and radioactive waste. Stresses societies’ need to develop ways of using less energy. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Energy. Ep. 1. The Dilemma
results.brief_description: Discusses past, present and future energy growth patterns. Explores problems of supply and demand, depletion of fossil fuels, our dependency and economic and social problems. Stresses societies’ need to develop ways of using less energy. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Energy, food and exercise
results.creator_credit: Barry Pierce, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Roger Lupton
results.brief_description: A humorous presentation equating the human body with a machine. Raises issues about the effects of lifestyle on health, bodyweight and fitness. Suitable for lower and middle secondary levels.

results.title: Energy Victoria
results.brief_description: A brief promotional overview of the corporate activities of Energy Victoria. Services highlighted are those which assist clients to conserve energy and allow for the development of renewable resources. There is no dialogue but the images are accompanied by a soundtrack.
